newsitem.title: FRANCE: French car boss Calvet says euro doomed - paper.
newsitem.headline: French car boss Calvet says euro doomed - paper.

text.p: Jacques Calvet, the chairman of French carmaker PSA Peugeot Citroen and a longtime critic of the European drive to establish a single currency, said in an interview that the project was doomed to fail.

Calvet said it looked likely that the euro would be established on schedule in 1999. "But I think after that -- three months or 18 months later, who knows -- there will be a collapse of the single currency in the way we're establishing it," he told the French newspaper La Tribune.

"Europeans say they are convinced that it's impossible to arrive at a political and unitary vision of Europe, that it's important to begin from a technical basis and to hide from people the fact that we're constructing a political entity," he said.
"With this approach, any effort is doomed to failure," he said. "I hope the euro will not be created on January 1, 1999, because my view is that, under those conditions, it won't survive," he said.

"I think it's clear that the problems are more complicated than we'd envisaged," he said, but added that the PSA group was preparing for the change in its data systems, accounting and other financial activities.
